measured_by: drift rate (v) parameter of the Diffusion Decision Model
justification: The authors state that their focus was on "two psychological constructs… task efficiency (drift rate) and caution (threshold)", explicitly linking the construct of task-efficiency to the drift-rate parameter v.

measured_by: decision threshold (a) parameter of the Diffusion Decision Model
justification: The paper explains that caution is operationalised by the diffusion model’s threshold parameter, noting the construct pair "caution (threshold)" when describing the model parameters.

measured_by: starting-point (z) parameter of the Diffusion Decision Model
justification: In the Figure 1 description, the starting point z is said to "reflect the bias towards a specific response", directly mapping response bias to the z parameter.

measured_by: non-decision time (t0) parameter of the Diffusion Decision Model
justification: The figure caption notes that "t0 refers to the components unrelated to accumulation… such as perceptual encoding", indicating that non-decision time indexes sensory / perceptual encoding processes.

measured_by: non-decision time (t0) parameter of the Diffusion Decision Model
justification: The same caption specifies that t0 also captures "motor response", linking the construct of motor responding to the t0 (non-decision time) parameter.
